CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1953, pg. 6, reads: "Prisoner Spokesman Interviewed - Western Penitentiary inmate Alfred Early crouches close to the barred window to give reporter Paul G. Gardner his views on 'What's wrong with the prison and the officials.' Inmate Early was a member of a convict 'truce team' which finally reached peace with prison authorities after 1,100 inmates staged a quarter-of-a-million-dollar riot nearly two weeks ago in protest over prison policies.  Probes of the prisoner's charges have been suggested by both the state and District Atty. James F. Malone Jr. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Reporter Paul G. Gardner interviewing three inmates, including Alfred Early, in jail cell at Western Penitentiary
